com.moomoohk.Grame.Basics

Class Wall

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moomoohk.Grame.Core.GrameObject
      • com.moomoohk.Grame.Basics.Wall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Wall
extends GrameObject
    Walls are ready to use GrameObjects which are supposed to represent ordinary walls.
    Since:
    2013-04-05
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Meshulam Silk (moomoohk@ymail.com)
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • isCollidable

        public boolean isCollidable()
        Description copied from class: GrameObject
        Checks whether this object is collidable.

        If this object is collidable, other objects on the same GrameObjectLayer will not be able to occupy the same spot.
        If this object is not collidable, it will be consumed by any collidable object that tries to occupy its spot.

        Specified by:
        isCollidable in class GrameObject
        Returns:
        True if collidable, else false.
        See Also:
        GrameObject.consume(GrameObject)

      • tick

        public void tick(int gID)
        Description copied from class: GrameObject
        Ticks this object.

        Users will never need to call this method (The GrameManager takes care of ticking everything).

        Specified by:
        tick in class GrameObject
        Parameters:
        gID - The Grid.ID of the Grid in which to tick.

      • consume

        public void consume(GrameObject go)
        Description copied from class: GrameObject
        This method gets called if this object is collidable and it tries to occupy the position of a non collidable object.
        Specified by:
        consume in class GrameObject
        Parameters:
        go - A non collidable Grame Object.
